question: Question_01_(h)
statement:
Let

\[\displaystyle 
A = \begin{bmatrix}
1 & 2 & 3 & -2 & 4\\
2 & 5 & 8 & -1 & 6\\
1 & 4 & 7 & 5 & 2\\
1 & 3 & 5 & 1 & 2\\
\end{bmatrix}\]

and

\[\displaystyle 
U = \begin{bmatrix}
1 & 2 & 3 & -2 & 4\\
0 & 1 & 2 & 3 & -2\\
0 & 0 & 0 & 1 & 2\\
0 & 0 & 0 & 0 & 0\\
\end{bmatrix}\]

Then the matrix \emph{U} is an echelon form for \emph{A} (you may assume
this, you don't have to do the row reduction again.)

Find all solutions to the system of equations

\begin{align*}
1x  +2y + 3z -2w = 4\\
2x  +5y + 8z -1w = 6\\
1x  +4y + 7z +5w = 2\\
1x  +3y + 5z +1w = 2\\
\end{align*}

(Hint: What is the augmented matrix for this system?)
sols:
1.) Transform the system of equations into an augmented matrix.
x,y,z,\&w all represent one column each and the number of system of
equations represent the rows of the matrix. The answers to each equation
will be on the right-most of the matrix.

2.) $\begin{vmatrix}
1 &2 & 3 & -2 &4 \\ 
2& 5 & 8 & -1 &6 \\ 
1& 4& 7 & 5&2 \\ 
1& 3& 5 & 1 &2 
\end{vmatrix}$3.) Let$^{\prime}$s reduce it to row echelon form by following these
steps: 1. $R_{2}$ = -2$R_{1}$ + $R_{2}$ 2. $R_{3}$ = -1$R_{1}$ + $R_{3}$
3. $R_{4}$ = -1$R_{1}$ + $R_{4}$ 4. $R_{3}$ = -2$R_{2}$ + $R_{3}$ 5.
$R_{4}$ = -1$R_{2}$ + $R_{4}$ 6. $R_{2}$ = -3$R_{3}$ + $R_{2}$ 7.
$R_{1}$ = 2$R_{3}$ + $R_{1}$ 8. $R_{1}$ = -2$R_{2}$ + $R_{1}$and we will end up with $\begin{vmatrix}
1 &0 & -1 & 0 & 24 \\ 
0& 1 &2 & 0 &-8 \\ 
0& 0& 0 & 1&2 \\ 
0& 0& 0 & 0 &0 
\end{vmatrix}$The right most values in column 5 are the answers.

4.) Therefore, the system of equations correspond to:

$x_{1}$= $x_{3}$ + 24 $x_{2}$ = -2$x_{3}$ - 8 $x_{3}$= $x_{3}$ $x_{4}$=
2All solutions are represented by\[\begin{bmatrix}
x_{1}\\ 
x_{2}\\ 
x_{3}\\ 
x_{4}\\ 
\end{bmatrix}\] = $x_{3}\begin{bmatrix}
1\\ 
-2\\ 
1\\ 
0
\end{bmatrix} + \begin{bmatrix}
24\\ 
-8\\ 
0\\ 
2
\end{bmatrix}$
